messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Ken Mack
messages.msgSnippet: Yes it is true. A member of McClafferty Sensei s dojo called and told me. I remember him from the Houston sword shows 20 years ago. What a riot he was. When
messages.messageBody:
Yes it is true. A member of McClafferty Sensei's dojo called and told me. I
remember him from the Houston sword shows 20 years ago. What a riot he was.
When that guy walked in teh room he sort of took over. Bad jokes and teh
whole bit. Fearless. A lot of fun to be around. I spoke to him a few months
ago and he was weak then. But he survived so long with his desease I
understand it has not been done before. God bless him and his family. BO
Elder

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Ken Mack
messages.msgSnippet: What a guy, Ken Mack! It was in 1992 when my wife began her one year struggle with cancer. At her last sword show--probably in Houston I guess--Ken, who was
messages.messageBody:
What a guy, Ken Mack! It was in 1992 when my wife began her one year struggle with cancer. At her last sword show--probably in Houston I guess--Ken, who was also struggling and somehow surviving his cancer, had a wonderful "pep-talk" with Kathy that truly helped her to continue her treatments. It amazes me to realize Ken survived another eleven years. He shall be missed!

Ron
STL
----- Original Message -----
From: tom helm
To: tom helm
Sent: Sunday, August 10, 2003 8:35 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Ken Mack


Some of you may have known Ken Mack from sword collecting, restoration, or
in martial arts.

I heard today he has passed away.

May we keep him and his family in our prayers.

Sam C.

This was posted to another list. Has anyone else heard this? hoping
it is not true...
-t
